study.study_title: Wen et al., Immune cell profiling of COVID-19 patients in the recovery stage by single-cell sequencing
study.lab_name: National Center for Liver Cancer, Second Military Medical University
study.study_description: An inflammatory immune signature in the early recovery stage of COVID-19 suggests patients are still vulnerable after hospital discharge.
study.grants: National Natural Science Foundation of China, award number 81722034, 81670015, 81830054, 81530028, 91953122, 31871326, 81721003, 81988101; Ministry of Science and Technology Key Program, award number 2018ZX09101002, 2017ZX100203205; Shanghai Pujiang Program, award number 2019PJD059; Guangdong Natural Science Funds for Distinguished Young Scholar, award number 2016A030306006, 2020B1515020057
study.lab_address: Second Military Medical University, 200438 Shanghai, China

sample.tissue_processing: PBMCs isolated from heparinized venous blood using Ficoll-Hypaque density solution; cell viability exceeded 80%
sample.library_generation_protocol: Single-cell suspensions of samples were converted to barcoded scRNA-seq libraries using the Chromium Single Cell 5′ Library and Gel Bead Kit v2 (PN-120237), Multiplex Kit, and Chip Kit (10x Genomics). Full-length TCR/BCR V(D)J segments were enriched from amplified cDNA from 5′ libraries via PCR amplification using a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit (10x Genomics) according to the manufacturer’s protocol.

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Processing by iReceptor: TCR sequences for each single T cell were assembled by Cell Ranger vdj pipeline (v.4.0.0) with command: cellranger vdj --localcores=1 --localmem=7 --id=$SUBJECT-$CELL-$SLURM_JOB_ID --reference=$CELLRANGER/10x-genome-refdata/refdata-cellranger-vdj-GRCh38-alts-ensembl-4.0.0 --fastqs=$PROJ_DIR/$SUBJECT/$CELL. TRA annotations were obtained with command: for subject in *; do cd $subject/t-cell; head -n 1  airr_rearrangement.tsv > $subject-TRA.tsv; egrep 'TRA[VDJ][0-9]'  airr_rearrangement.tsv >> $subject-TRA.tsv; done

study.grants: National Natural Science Foundation of China, award number 81722034, 81670015, 81830054, 81530028, 91953122, 31871326, 81721003, 81988101; Ministry of Science and Technology Key Program, award number 2018ZX09101002, 2017ZX100203205; Shanghai Pujiang Program, award number 2019PJD059; Guangdong Natural Science Funds for Distinguished Young Scholar, award number 2016A030306006, 2020B1515020057
study.lab_address: Second Military Medical University, 200438 Shanghai, China

sample.tissue_processing: PBMCs isolated from heparinized venous blood using Ficoll-Hypaque density solution; cell viability exceeded 80%
sample.library_generation_protocol: Single-cell suspensions of samples were converted to barcoded scRNA-seq libraries using the Chromium Single Cell 5′ Library and Gel Bead Kit v2 (PN-120237), Multiplex Kit, and Chip Kit (10x Genomics). Full-length TCR/BCR V(D)J segments were enriched from amplified cDNA from 5′ libraries via PCR amplification using a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit (10x Genomics) according to the manufacturer’s protocol.

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Processing by iReceptor: BCR sequences for each single B cell were assembled by Cell Ranger vdj pipeline (v.4.0.0) with command: cellranger vdj --localcores=1 --localmem=7 --id=$SUBJECT-$CELL-$SLURM_JOB_ID --reference=$CELLRANGER/10x-genome-refdata/refdata-cellranger-vdj-GRCh38-alts-ensembl-4.0.0 --fastqs=$PROJ_DIR/$SUBJECT/$CELL. IGL annotations were obtained with command: for subject in *; do cd $subject/b-cell; head -n 1  airr_rearrangement.tsv > $subject-IGL.tsv; egrep 'IGL[VDJ][0-9]'  airr_rearrangement.tsv >> $subject-IGL.tsv; done

study.grants: National Natural Science Foundation of China, award number 81722034, 81670015, 81830054, 81530028, 91953122, 31871326, 81721003, 81988101; Ministry of Science and Technology Key Program, award number 2018ZX09101002, 2017ZX100203205; Shanghai Pujiang Program, award number 2019PJD059; Guangdong Natural Science Funds for Distinguished Young Scholar, award number 2016A030306006, 2020B1515020057
study.lab_address: Second Military Medical University, 200438 Shanghai, China

sample.tissue_processing: PBMCs isolated from heparinized venous blood using Ficoll-Hypaque density solution; cell viability exceeded 80%
sample.library_generation_protocol: Single-cell suspensions of samples were converted to barcoded scRNA-seq libraries using the Chromium Single Cell 5′ Library and Gel Bead Kit v2 (PN-120237), Multiplex Kit, and Chip Kit (10x Genomics). Full-length TCR/BCR V(D)J segments were enriched from amplified cDNA from 5′ libraries via PCR amplification using a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit (10x Genomics) according to the manufacturer’s protocol.

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Processing by iReceptor: BCR sequences for each single B cell were assembled by Cell Ranger vdj pipeline (v.4.0.0) with command: cellranger vdj --localcores=1 --localmem=7 --id=$SUBJECT-$CELL-$SLURM_JOB_ID --reference=$CELLRANGER/10x-genome-refdata/refdata-cellranger-vdj-GRCh38-alts-ensembl-4.0.0 --fastqs=$PROJ_DIR/$SUBJECT/$CELL. IGK annotations were obtained with command: for subject in *; do cd $subject/b-cell; head -n 1  airr_rearrangement.tsv > $subject-IGK.tsv; egrep 'IGK[VDJ][0-9]'  airr_rearrangement.tsv >> $subject-IGK.tsv; done

study.grants: National Natural Science Foundation of China, award number 81722034, 81670015, 81830054, 81530028, 91953122, 31871326, 81721003, 81988101; Ministry of Science and Technology Key Program, award number 2018ZX09101002, 2017ZX100203205; Shanghai Pujiang Program, award number 2019PJD059; Guangdong Natural Science Funds for Distinguished Young Scholar, award number 2016A030306006, 2020B1515020057
study.lab_address: Second Military Medical University, 200438 Shanghai, China

sample.tissue_processing: PBMCs isolated from heparinized venous blood using Ficoll-Hypaque density solution; cell viability exceeded 80%
sample.library_generation_protocol: Single-cell suspensions of samples were converted to barcoded scRNA-seq libraries using the Chromium Single Cell 5′ Library and Gel Bead Kit v2 (PN-120237), Multiplex Kit, and Chip Kit (10x Genomics). Full-length TCR/BCR V(D)J segments were enriched from amplified cDNA from 5′ libraries via PCR amplification using a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit (10x Genomics) according to the manufacturer’s protocol.

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Processing by iReceptor: BCR sequences for each single B cell were assembled by Cell Ranger vdj pipeline (v.4.0.0) with command: cellranger vdj --localcores=1 --localmem=7 --id=$SUBJECT-$CELL-$SLURM_JOB_ID --reference=$CELLRANGER/10x-genome-refdata/refdata-cellranger-vdj-GRCh38-alts-ensembl-4.0.0 --fastqs=$PROJ_DIR/$SUBJECT/$CELL. IGH annotations were obtained with command: for subject in *; do cd $subject/b-cell; head -n 1  airr_rearrangement.tsv > $subject-IGH.tsv; egrep 'IGH[VDJ][0-9]'  airr_rearrangement.tsv >> $subject-IGH.tsv; done

study.grants: National Natural Science Foundation of China, award number 81722034, 81670015, 81830054, 81530028, 91953122, 31871326, 81721003, 81988101; Ministry of Science and Technology Key Program, award number 2018ZX09101002, 2017ZX100203205; Shanghai Pujiang Program, award number 2019PJD059; Guangdong Natural Science Funds for Distinguished Young Scholar, award number 2016A030306006, 2020B1515020057
study.lab_address: Second Military Medical University, 200438 Shanghai, China

sample.tissue_processing: PBMCs isolated from heparinized venous blood using Ficoll-Hypaque density solution; cell viability exceeded 80%
sample.library_generation_protocol: Single-cell suspensions of samples were converted to barcoded scRNA-seq libraries using the Chromium Single Cell 5′ Library and Gel Bead Kit v2 (PN-120237), Multiplex Kit, and Chip Kit (10x Genomics). Full-length TCR/BCR V(D)J segments were enriched from amplified cDNA from 5′ libraries via PCR amplification using a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit (10x Genomics) according to the manufacturer’s protocol.

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Processing by iReceptor: TCR sequences for each single T cell were assembled by Cell Ranger vdj pipeline (v.4.0.0) with command: cellranger vdj --localcores=1 --localmem=7 --id=$SUBJECT-$CELL-$SLURM_JOB_ID --reference=$CELLRANGER/10x-genome-refdata/refdata-cellranger-vdj-GRCh38-alts-ensembl-4.0.0 --fastqs=$PROJ_DIR/$SUBJECT/$CELL. TRB annotations were obtained with command: for subject in *; do cd $subject/t-cell; head -n 1  airr_rearrangement.tsv > $subject-TRB.tsv; egrep 'TRB[VDJ][0-9]'  airr_rearrangement.tsv >> $subject-TRB.tsv; done

study.grants: National Natural Science Foundation of China, award number 81722034, 81670015, 81830054, 81530028, 91953122, 31871326, 81721003, 81988101; Ministry of Science and Technology Key Program, award number 2018ZX09101002, 2017ZX100203205; Shanghai Pujiang Program, award number 2019PJD059; Guangdong Natural Science Funds for Distinguished Young Scholar, award number 2016A030306006, 2020B1515020057
study.lab_address: Second Military Medical University, 200438 Shanghai, China

sample.tissue_processing: PBMCs isolated from heparinized venous blood using Ficoll-Hypaque density solution; cell viability exceeded 80%
sample.library_generation_protocol: Single-cell suspensions of samples were converted to barcoded scRNA-seq libraries using the Chromium Single Cell 5′ Library and Gel Bead Kit v2 (PN-120237), Multiplex Kit, and Chip Kit (10x Genomics). Full-length TCR/BCR V(D)J segments were enriched from amplified cDNA from 5′ libraries via PCR amplification using a Chromium Single-Cell V(D)J Enrichment kit (10x Genomics) according to the manufacturer’s protocol.

data_processing.data_processing_protocols: Processing by iReceptor: TCR sequences for each single T cell were assembled by Cell Ranger vdj pipeline (v.4.0.0) with command: cellranger vdj --localcores=1 --localmem=7 --id=$SUBJECT-$CELL-$SLURM_JOB_ID --reference=$CELLRANGER/10x-genome-refdata/refdata-cellranger-vdj-GRCh38-alts-ensembl-4.0.0 --fastqs=$PROJ_DIR/$SUBJECT/$CELL. TRA annotations were obtained with command: for subject in *; do cd $subject/t-cell; head -n 1  airr_rearrangement.tsv > $subject-TRA.tsv; egrep 'TRA[VDJ][0-9]'  airr_rearrangement.tsv >> $subject-TRA.tsv; done
